alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 15 at 4:38PM CST until December 15 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts up to 75 mph. For the Blowing Dust Warning, visibility less than one quarter mile in blowing dust. * WHERE...Furnas, Harlan, Franklin, Webster, Nuckolls and Thayer Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Severely limited visibilities are expected. Travel will be dangerous and possibly life-threatening. Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Through this afternoon, winds across the area will be southerly to southwesterly. Through the evening hours, winds will turn more northwesterly as a cold front passes through the area. The strongest winds are expected to be out of south, west, and northwest.
info.instruction: People with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster
